The cold brew sounded amazing, the cookie crumble is my favorite part about The Tonight Dough, and the liquor truffle sounded great considering the complemented flavors. The cold brew ice cream was left a little lacking in my opinion but was edible. The fudge and cookie crumble was really good, but I could not get over the truffle itself. It tasted too strong and overpowered everything else, which I wouldn’t mind, if it had tasted good. It was too strong, and too fake of a liquor taste. I love you B&J, your Tonight Dough and Phish Food are amazing, but the truffle just didn’t cut it for me, and the ice cream itself was lacking.

Not bad, but the other Ben and Jerry’s coffee flavors are better, in my opinion. The ice cream was very good but the truffles were too strong for my taste, and a little strange. The chocolate swirl was also a little too intense. You can definitely taste that it’s cold brew as opposed to regular coffee and it’s impressive that B&J was able to capture that difference. No amateur ice cream makers, this group.

I love Ben & Jerry's. I especially love the mocha and coffee flavored ice creams, so I was very excited to try Chillin' the Roast. I am sorry to report it is by far the worst B&J flavor that I've ever tried. The cold brew flavored ice cream was fine, it was not offensive and with the right add-ins it could have been a decent flavor. However, the truffles were terrible; they tasted sour and occasionally a little like blue cheese. I'm sad this was so bad, I wanted to love it.

I had two or 3 pints of this before not being able to find it. It’s my new favorite after Coffee Heath Bar changed its ingredients and was no longer irresistible. The coffee flavor is a little different, not as sweet — and the truffles, true to their name, have a liquer flavor. Wonderful combination if you love coffee! I guess on one hand, I’m relieved not to be eating it regularly since losing weight has been easier, but I miss finding it on my grocery trips...please restock!!

I actually really loved the coffee flavor of this ice cream. My usual favorite is Coffee Coffee Buzz Buzz Buzz, but I can only ever find that in scoop shops (which I rarely patronize). The Chillin' the Roast Truffles was available at my grocery store so I pounced. It has a taste that people who enjoy dark roast coffee, plain cold brew, black coffee, or deep espressos will enjoy in my opinion. A lot of coffee ice creams just have a very mild coffee flavor you can barely detect beneath the plain sugar and cream flavor. This was true coffee and tasted excellent.

column4: A better name would be chillin the tastebuds
column5: Got a small pint of this from a friend who thought I'd enjoy it due to me bei g both an avid lover of chocolate & an avid lover of coffee. I was super stoked to crack it open tonight and dive into the creamy dream the description promised, only to be disappointed. The ice cream was grainy, the fudge was entirely overpowered by bitter cold brew, & the truffles tasted of nothing but bitter coconut--I had to stop eating and double check the flavour listing to be sure I hadn't made a mistake. This blend missed the mark, but at least there's rum in it? Hopefully b&j Wil try again at a coffee & chocolate combo, & hopefully it will be better than this.

I bought it last night at Target, and I really enjoyed it! It's so yummy! the truffles were delicious & coffee liqueur really hit me, eating it slowly is the best definitely will be returning to get more

Bold coffee flavor (more espresso bean than cold brew, I think, but I like it.) Thick fudgey truffles with a lovely top-shelf bourbon flavor. Oh my oh my. This is one delightful ice cream. Not for those who do not like whisky or strong coffee, but perfect for those who do.

I love this flavor. I am actually currently going back and forth between the caramel chocolate cheesecake truffle, and this one. If you LOVE Coffee, you'll love this. When you hit one of the truffles, it is like an explosion of delicious coffee liqueur on your tongue-and you get a little crunch from the cookie crumble, which all fits perfectly together. It is perfect for curling up and watching the latest episode of your favorite show, or even movie night.

I'm a huge fan of coffee ice cream, and I've tried many different brands of coffee ice cream. When I picked up Chillin the Roast yesterday, I was amazed at first with the mocha taste. Then out of nowhere I get a huge coffee bean and it was so bitter and strong. It unbalances and overpowers The chocolate and the ice cream itself. It was really good, probably top 3 in my coffee ice cream suggestions. However I found myself avoiding the coffee bits after cringing while getting past the bitterness.

First of all everyone should try ice cream flavors at least twice. I never pass judgement till I have something more than once.
I am kot a coffee addicted and I have to say that my significant other love this flavor. Great balance of flavors in the ingredients.

Wish all stores that carry Ben & Jerry's have this flavor. I stopped going to my go-to grocery store just because they don't carry this flavor. This might be my favorite Ben & Jerry's ice cream. I like how it it not too sweet.
Just a misfire. The candy pieces are terrible tasting. Did not enjoy. Your boozy flavors tend to be bad.

I love the coffee ice cream but would like more chocolate swirl and no truffles at all. The truffles taste horrible. i can’t even describe what they taste like because I have never tasted anything like them. Rework it minus the truffles and I’m in but until then, it’s a no for me.

column4: The flavor is to die for. Coffee lovers dream.
column5: Decadent flavors not only with the coffee but the liqueur taste. Definetly and adults sweet paradise. Once you’ve had it nothing will be the same. A+++
I was so excited when I got the e-mail about this - went to a scoop shop immediately to pick up hoping it would bring me back to my beloved Dublin Mudslide.

I love coffee with a passion! I also enjoy B&J’s ice cream from time to time. I was very excited after reading the title of this container, “Chillin’ the Roast Truffles”. Description is cold brew coffee, which I adore. I was very disappointed to find out the truffles in this container tastes like straight up coffee brandy liquor. I hate the truffles and for the first time in my life left this ice cream sitting in my freezer for a week, then ended up throwing it away. The ice cream itself was great!! It’s a no from me for the truffles.

DEFINITELY have to be a coffee lover to enjoy this! I absolutely love the flavor of the cold brew ice cream, tastes almost identical to chocolate covered espresso beans in my opinion. I think there should be just a little bit more swirl to help balance the coffee. The only thing I think I dont enjoy as much is the coffee liqueur truffles. On their own, the taste is very odd. However, if you eat them with the ice cream at the same time I think it works out. Definitely not my #1 favorite, but likely wont be the only time i have it.

I bought this a couple days ago thinking that I would venture away from my beloved Chunky Monkey and Coffee Toffee Bar Crunch and given that I usually love all things Ben & Jerry's fully expected to love this. I tried it the first night, took a few bites and immediately hated it only to try it again tonight thinking maybe it was a fluke but sadly it was not. This ice cream tastes so much like leftover coffee grounds both in flavor and texture that it wasn't even edible. This is the first time I've ever thrown out a pint uneaten.

Let me just say first off, this ice cream was absolutely delicious. I mean I LOVED it, until I found out that there was alcohol in it. I don’t drink alcohol and I wish there was some sort of warning on there. It didn’t taste cooked off (I hope it was)

Like most people, I love Ben & Jerry's ice cream. There are so many wonderful flavors that I don't even have a go-to; I get something different every time! So of course, when I saw a new coffee flavor, I had to try it. However, for the first time, I was rather unsatisfied. The coffee ice cream itself was good, but, as others have said, the truffles are gross, and there is little to no chocolate swirl. This is one I'll be sure to never buy again.
my new fav, its perf, dont know what them haterz be thinkin

I just tossed this in the trash! It is the worst flavor I have ever tried and I have tried alot! I have never met a Ben and Jerry's ice cream flavor I didn't like...until now. Dont waste your money! Buy coffee coffee buzz buzz or coffee and heath or anything else instead! I couldn't even swallow the truffles they were that bad. The rum flavor is so pungent! The ice cream flavor could be passable but the texture is grainy. Definately doesn't even deserve the 1 star as I threw it in the trash.

The cold brew ice cream was delicious! BUT the truffles were appalling. They were WAY to sweet and bitter. Just overpowering and offputing to where I couldn’t even finish half the pint. I’m a big coffee lover, but this ice cream was just a fail. Probably my least favorite Ben and Jerry’s flavor I’ve tried thus far.

This has easily moved up to my new favorite! The icecream has a strong coffee flavor, and the taste is bold. If you don't like strong flavors it may not be for you. But for someone who has coffee in her veins it is perfect. The truffles and chocolate liquor and fudge swirls put it over the top!

Just bought some Chillin' the Roast and love it, would not change a thing. The ice cream tastes just like cold brew coffee so naturally you should enjoy coffee if you are buying this. The coffee liqueur-filled truffles are really good and are the perfect pair to the cold brew coffee ice cream.

column4: Ice cream flavor is great, truffles not so much
column5: I love coffee and coffee ice cream, so I was really excited to try this and had high hopes. I was disappointed, sadly.

The cold brew ice cream was great-really strong coffee flavor. The fudge swirls are also great and balance out the acidity of the coffee flavor, but the truffles are absolutely disgusting. I'd give it a higher rating, but there were so many truffles it was hard to get a bite without them. There's also not enough fudge swirls. If this didn't have the truffles it would be one of my favorite flavors.
Wow this was surprisingly terrible. Only are a few bites and didn't even want to eat anymore. Can't imagine how anyone would like this.

I love your coffee/chocolate combinations (Coffee Coffee Buzz Buzz is my favorite), but this one was nasty. I came to your website and the reviews for the first time ever (and I've been eating Ben and Jerry's forever), just to see if maybe I missed a hazelnut ingredient coating the truffles (I hate hazelnut). Or something that didn't belong. The coffee ice cream was awesome, until (I guess) I bit into a truffle. Ugh. I actually just tossed $5 of ice cream into the trash.

The ice cream base was grainy, as if product had melted and been refrozen. It didn't taste like coffee. It tasted like grainy ice milk with a mild and bland flavor. I couldn't comment on the truffles, as other reviewers have, because the sandy texture of the base - neither creamy nor tasty -was so disappointing I put it back in my freezer after three bites. I am hoping my local grocer will offer a refund. This pint was a terrible disappointment!

I was so hoping to find a new favorite coffee ice cream, but the texture was a bit more grainy than usual, and I was shocked by the truffles... wow they were so strong! They tasted like an unnatural chemical. I had my husband try it and he had to spit it out. So sad! We love B&J’s!

I love coffee and was very excited to see this new flavor at the grocery store. I couldn't wait to get home and try it and to say the least I was not disappointed. Hands down the best coffee ice cream I have ever tried. I have already retuned to get more. Love it, love it, love it. Well done Ben & Jerry's!!

column4: I'll finish the pint, but probably won't buy again
column5: Since I had just finished a pint of "Coffee, Coffee, Buzz Buzz Buzz" I figured I would try this one. They are incredibly different in every way, from color to taste to ingredients, so I wouldn't compare the two. I would like the ice cream on its own, the cold brew ice cream would be good with chocolate chips as a iced-mocha flavor concept. But with these truffles, listed as "chocolate-cookie covered liqueur truffles", the chocolate (which tastes just like chocolate, not sure where the cookie is), does not stay attached to the truffle inside. The liqueur truffle itself is the consistency of cookie butter, I was expecting the something harder. They definitely give a bit of a kick, which may not be what you are into. I plan on finishing the pint, but I think I have to be in the mood for it and it won't be the first thing in the fridge that I reach for.
I bought this because they were out of buzz,buzz,buzz. I didn't know there was a way to mess up coffee icecream but this is it.

I loved everything about this flavor and I think it may have replaced Cherry Garcia as my new favorite. I like the heavy coffee flavoring of the ice cream — it’s a bolder coffee flavor than previous Ben & Jerry’s offerings. It’s sweet without being too sweet, which gives the gooey chocolate swirl ample room to shine AND some added sweetness from the gloriously boozy truffles. I’m gonna need to get another pint of this soon!

The ice cream itself and chocolate swirl are great, but the truffles... ooh boy. This is the first BJ review I have ever given, and I actually came to the website to see if I had gotten a bad batch, or if everyone else had the same reaction to this flavor. Bitter and sour taste.

I always look forward to new flavors so I had to try this one. I have to say that this is the worst flavor I have ever tried! Weak coffee flavor, no sign of a chocolate swirl and the truffles were inedible. This is the first pint of Ben and Jerry’s that I could not finish.

column4: Best appreciated by TRUE coffee addicts
column5: I thought this flavor was AMAZING. Though I’m not a huge coffee liquer fan, you get exactly what they advertise. I thought the truffles complimented the overall flavor, which is definitely overwhelmingly deliciously rich strong coffee. Love it, new favorite for sure.

I normally love Ben and Jerry's, and coffee is my weakness... this though. Just a miss. I didn't care for the taste or the texture of the truffles-- very weird. I agree around them for a whole, but ultimately threw away more of the pint than its ever have imagined. The swirls were alright, but the gritty texture of the coffee grounds in the ice cream was way too much for me. Sorry, guys. This was not a winner.

column4: Actual ice cream, delicious. Truffles are a fail.
column5: I was torn between the two new truffle flavors, and decided to go with this one. The cold brew coffee ice cream is a LITTLE grainy but not like others I’ve had. The texture of the truffles was nice, but the flavor was a total turn off. I ended up eating around them until they were too hard to avoid. Then I threw the rest away. Granted, I’m not a booze person, but the truffle flavor was truly acrid. Too bad!

column4: The only flavor I can’t eat
column5: I love Ben & Jerry’s and I love coffee, but the coffee liquor “truffles” are strong and nasty. And it tastes like crushed coffee beans throughout the ice cream and not in a good way. Hardly any chocolate (at least not in the pint I purchased). I never say this, (but this is an exception), this flavor is a flop.

I bought this simply because the flavor I REALLY wanted wasn't on the shelf and I figured "why not?" The description on front sounded great but I was slightly disappointed to find light colored ice cream when I took off the lid (I don't care for vanilla) but one bite in, I was a fan. The cold-brew coffee flavor is powerful and is even better than the flavor of ice cream in Coffee BuzzBuzzBuzz! And the fudge swirls match that flavor perfectly. But what I found did not fit well were the truffles. They added a bitter taste and I found they did not mesh well with the other flavors. I figured I could just eat around them or scoop them out. Sadly, the shells are to fragile and broke when I tried this. After 15 mins of trying to avoid their bitterness, I ended up throwing the pint away. I was able to enjoy about a quarter of the ice cream and fudge. Awesome effort but needs adjustment (imo.)

column4: Best B&J's Coffee Base, But Not a Fan of Truffles
column5: Cold brew base is more of an espresso type, studded with flecks of coffee. This is the best coffee base I've ever tasted by B&J. Then, you get a bite of truffle. The coffee liqueur filling is overpowering; you should really, really like coffee liqueur to enjoy these. For me, they ruined the pint

column4: A special occasion flavor for adults
column5: This is for adults. This is delicious. This may be my favorite flavor in decades, but it is a flavor to be savored and even thought about. It's very complex, and you should enjoy it at various temperatures to get all the coffee flavors. The texture is relatively simple, and the chocolate around the truffles could be slightly darker and nicer, but bravo to whoever put this recipe together.

I just finished off a pint I got this week. I had been looking for a decadent chocolate flavor when I found this
instead. As a coffee lover who rarely drinks alcohol, I do love coffee flavored liqueur. This ice cream had just the right amount of chocolate around the liqueur truffles. The focus was on the coffee and liqueur, rather than the chocolate, and it’s instantly become my new fav!

column4: Great ice cream flavor, terrible truffles.
column5: The showcase of this ice cream should be the truffles, however the ice cream is really what makes this product ok. The ice cream is beautifully executed however, the truffles are rather disgusting. The chocolate fudge is excellent. I found myself throwing out the truffles and unable to finish, it just was awful running into the truffles. They have a very bad flavor that is unpalatable.

This flavor is so bad that Chillin' the Roast is the first pint of Ben & Jerry's that I ever threw in the garbage. It has a very odd, un-ice-cream like texture and weird flavors. It's kind of foamy and the flavors are so strange that I can't even describe them. I looked at the ingredients and it's full of gums, carrageenan, canola and soybean oils and 'natural flavors'. Mystery solved.

column4: Not for me. Probably not you either.
column5: I actually accidentally grabbed a pint of this, I was want the Chocolate Cheesecake Truffle. I got messed up by the both being truffle ice cream! However I was already home when I realized it. The taste of this ice cream is horrible. It's souer and the coffee over powers everything else. I only ate a few spoons and I was done. Probably the worst ice cream I've ever tasted.

column4: Weak coffee flavor, invisible fudge swirl
column5: Picked up this, because I love really good coffee ice cream, and a pint of Phish Food. Good thing I had the Phish Food, because this has weak, milky coffee ice cream, had no visible fudge swirls, and the coffee liqueur truffles tasted more like butterscotch. You guys need to tase some of your premium ice cream competitors coffee ice cream, or call this one "Cafe au Lait".

I love cold brew coffee and I love coffee ice creams. The truffles were a huge let down and didn't really taste much like coffee and had a weird alcohol liqeur thing going on. Also there was a air pocket in the bottom of my pint so I was missing about a quarter of product. I wish my local stores carried the other coffee flavors because this one did not meet the mark.
Not good. The coffee liquor truffles taste weird and the overall flavor doesn’t mesh with all the flavors. Very disappointed and I love all B&J flavors.

column4: I love Ben and Jerry's EXCEPT THIS FLACOR
column5: This is one of the only flavors i've thrown into the trash. Don't waste your time. Eat any other wonder flavor they have... just not this mess.

column4: Coffee ice cream done right just for grown ups
column5: It isn’t amazing if you really like something complex and sweet and you are a fan of coffee you will love it. I see negative reviews but they were looking for something more standard they have their expectations for coffee flavored Ice cream. This is my favorite commercial ICe cream. It isn’t overly sweet and it has coffee and alcohol and chocolate it’s perfect!

This is a wonderful alternative to flavors often geared towards an overly sweet American pallet. The texture, taste and flavor combinations are incredible. This is the first Ben & Jerry's review I've ever left, and this is the flavor that compelled me to do so!

the icecream and fudge swirls taste amazing but the truffles are so revolting i litterally almost through up i would rather you guys bring back coffee coffee buzz buzz then continue this flavor as the biggest part of the icecream is the worst part... if you want to fix it get rid of the coffee liquer truffles and rreplace it with something expresso

I picked this up at the grocery store the other day. I had never seen it before and the description sounded amazing. The cold brew ice cream itself is amazing, but those liquor truffles are terrible. They have this over powering salty, alcohol caramel taste to them. I tried to eat around them but I eventually just threw it away. So disappointed!

I saw this ice cream and though it both looked and sounded amazing. Although the ice cream itself is yummy coffee deliciousness, those cookie-covered chocolate chunks are god awful. Or at least just not for me. The coffee flavor is very overwhelming and not at all what i expected. I tried suffering through but i couldn't. I'm disappointed lol
The coffee ice cream is ok! But the coffee liqueur bites are kinda butterscotch heavy!

I was so excited to see a coffee flavor, as it is one of my favorites. When I opened the carton, a wonderful coffee scent was released. Then the taste test. The ice cream and the fudge were fine, but the “truffles” were gross. I can’t describe the flavor, but it was very unpleasant. I doubt I’ll eat any more then the small sample I had.

I've always loved coffee ice cream and liqueur chocolates so for me this flavor was a huge hit. I first got it a few months back then had trouble finding it in stock again until now and was totally stoked to buy it again. Apparently it's a love it or hate it flavor so I would say try it for yourself. Don't let the haters change you B&J

column4: Coffee Ice Cream Like I've Never Had It Before
column5: This is an outstanding flavor that really re-imagines what can be done with coffee ice cream. I've had 3 pints already and I've only known about this flavor for a week! Some people have said the truffles taste weird, but I think they add a very unique flavor and this flavor should be kept as-is. I know I'll be buying it!

I picked this up this morning at the grocery. It's gone. One sitting. I'm not a super-sweet eater, but I broke the rules for this. Coffee flavor, then the liqueur taste...plus some crunchy yumminess to chew on. I am tempted to run to the store and buy the rest to deep freeze for when they take it out of circulation.

I bought this because I love coffee and chocolate, but the truffles made me gag! The truffles made the ice cream INEDIBLE. I did not know there was alcohol in this flavor and wish it would have been more obviously stated on the package as I do not drink. This has seriously broken my trust with Ben & Jerry's.

I loved the cold brew ice cream and the chocolate cookie crust, however the coffee liqueur truffle inside the cookie crust was super sweet and I could only handle about 2 chunks. After a while I just scooped those chunks of the truffle itself out of its crust and set them aside and tasted much better.

I usually love any Ben & Jerry's but unfortunately this is a big miss - I don't know any better way to describe it than to say it tastes kind of fuzzy. I'd rather have coffee flavored ice cream than the cold brew grounds even if the flavor is stronger. And the truffles are as bad as people say. Yikes.

Normally I can only eat a tiny amount of Ben and Jerry’s. I almost devoured this pint in one sitting. The malt flavor reminds me of the tiny malt cups with the wooden spoon that I would get from the ice cream man as a kid. Absolutely in love with this flavor. And mash mellow in there too!

column4: Finally the return of a REAL coffee flavor to B&J!
column5: Not since Aztec Harvest coffee has there been an ice cream flavor that has a good STRONG coffee flavor. Thank you B&J for finally fulfilling this much needed gap in the ice cream world! Only thing I'd love even more is a smooth mix-in free Espresso ice cream and I can die a happy man. :)

For me this flavor was a miss. The ice cream was gritty and the truffles tasted a little too boozy. I think the flavor combo could work with some adjustments but I won't be trying this one again. I'm still a Ben & Jerry's fan and will not hold one disappointing flavor against them.

I personally loved this new flavor. The coffee flavor is pretty strong and so are the coffee liquor truffles. I would definitely buy this ice cream flavor again. But if you’re not into that strong coffee flavor, I wouldn’t go for this one. Otherwise, definitely try it out! :)

Generally speaking I have loved trying new flavors but this one just didn't live up to my expectations. It had an odd aftertaste and the texture just wasn't appealing. Hoping the kids are less picky and will consume the rest of the pint otherwise it is getting tossed.

column4: Alcohol and ice cream don’t mix
column5: I bought this last night, seeing truffles in the title I was excited to try it. The part that I missed was the liqueur in it. Talk about gross... that may be the only time I’ve ever said that about a Ben and Jerry’s flavor... as I sit here in my Ben and Jerry’s shirt.

column4: Love the Ice Cream, Hate the Truffles
column5: I am a BIG coffee toffee bar crunch girl, and I haven’t been able to find it in my new city so I got this when I saw it. The ice cream is pretty good (4/5) but everytime I eat a truffle I feel like I’m taking a shot- they’re SO STRONG. I would prefer a normal truffle.

column4: I fell in love with Ben and Jerry's again
column5: Because of this flavor, well, the title says it all. It is my new favorite and I buy multiple containers in the store whenever i see it, especially when I'm not even intending on buying ice cream that day. No stores near me sell it and I wish more stores carried it.

column4: Very fake flavor in truffles, almost threw it away
column5: I bought this at my local grocery, and typically love coffee flavored treats from Ben & Jerrys, but the truffle bombs in this were just not good, the flavoring was overly artificial and almost antiseptic. Would have been better with a caramel swirl and no truffles!
This tastes like a frappuccino! It is bold in its flavor.

Really good. If you love coffee you will love this flavor. Every element of this flavor went together perfectly. the fudge swirls help balance the strong truffles. the base icecream is the winner in this pint though! best coffee flavor by far from Ben and Jerrys.

I love this flavor! It has a nice strong coffee flavor. The truffles go really well with the cold brew ice cream and the chocolate swirl adds the perfect amount of sweetness. I also love that it has little specs of coffee grounds ❤️ Perfect for any coffee lover!
My husband bought a pint of this and, on a whim because I don’t eat much ice cream, I tried a bit.

column4: A replacement for the Coffee Heath bar switcharoo
column5: Good coffee flavor and the little bites have a liquor flavor thats not overpowering. This is a good replacement for the ruined Coffee Heath bar after they removed the heath bar and substituted with some non goo garbage. Great job folks

My favorite part is the coffee ice cream. Just the right amount of bitter to compensate for the sweetness of the chocolate swirls. My only issue is the flavor of the truffles. Its too much. Too bitter. It doesn't work well with the rest of the flavors.

So. Incredibly. Good.
I don't know how those master minds did it but they captured the smell of a coffee shop. When I eat this ice cream I feel like I'm walking through a shopping mall and begin to catch the smell of coffee goodness drifting about.

I’m not even a particularly big coffee fan, but this flavor is AWESOME. I hope it sticks around. It’s easily in my top 3 all time favorites, and I think it would be a smart move to keep it given the ever-rising popularity of cold brew coffee.

I decided to try a new flavor because the idea sounded good, but it did not meet expectations of Ben & Jerry’s! The actual coffee flavored ice cream is good, but the truffles taste gross. Was this even taste tested before distribution??

This is by far my favorite! I love the delicious, true coffee flavor and the truffles are to die for. As a bona fide coffee junkie, I heartily recommend this ice cream! Now if only I could get it in a larger quantity than a pint...

column4: Chillin' In All The Right Ways!
column5: This is my new favorite. I was a huge White Russian fan and this is now my Treat Night go to. The coffee flavor is smooth and mellow, a slight bit of liquor and the textures of dark chocolate, this all dances on the tongue. I smile!

Delish! Bold coffee flavor balanced with creamy texture and melt in your mouth truffles, love it! I'm in Starbucks country where us Seattleites like our coffee treats strong so this hits the spot. Pleeeease make a non-dairy version

We just found the Chillin the Roast Truffles this week. The coffee flavor is rich and creamy. The chocolate cookie-covered coffee liqueur truffles are flavor packed and delicious. And swirls of fudge all through. We love it!

column4: Good Idea...but execution not so much
column5: I wanted to like this so much. If you only had the ice cream and more fudge swirl I think this would be better. Thise coffee liqueur cookie truffles ruined the ice cream. And the fudge swirl was almost non-existent in my pint.

The ice cream itself was okay for coffee lovers. The truffles were really yucky though, and I like coffee liqueur. Something just didn't taste right. And then the fudge swirls weren't good either! I could only have a few bites

Excited to find this new coffee flavor. Each bite was better than the last. The truffles were an extra bonus of thick chocolate and a creamy center. So delicious I will be requesting it to be stocked in my home town market.

Picjed this up when store didnt have brewed to matter. Super disapointed. Coffee flavor was okay. The rum and truffles was horrible. Rum was overpowering and super gross I had to toss this. Bring backmdublin mudslide.

I don’t understand all the negative reviews regarding the truffles tasting alcoholic. It says on the label that it contains liqueur! And boy does it deliver! I mean who could say no to caffeine and alcohol in an ice cream?

As someone who drinks alot of coffee this is amazing. it's sweet enough to counter balance the cold brew but the flavors still taste the coffee. The cookie bite help make it the go to I'm having a bad day.

The coffee ice cream in this flavor is so so but the truffles have a distinctly awful flavor. I ended up trying to pick around them and then just throwing it out. Definitely would never buy this again
This is just not good. For the first time ever, I ate a few bites and threw the rest away. The coffee ice cream itself is ok, but not with the combination of other flavors in there. I'm disappointed.
You guys still havent brought back Dublin Mudslide but this is an awfully steong competitor! I’m just having some trouble getting my hands on a second pint here in Brooklyn, NY. Happy scooping!
Ive been eating coffee icecream for almost 40 years. When I was little you could only find it in New England. This is by far my favorite coffee icecream, they nailed it. Hope it sticks around.

column4: I've never had a favorite ice cream, until now!
column5: From the first bite of Chillin' the Roast Truffles, my World was changed. 36 years and I've never come close to having a favorite Ice Cream. Bravo, Ben & Jerry, this flavour is a triumph!
I normally love your ice cream but this was a huge disappointment. Super bitter tasting and the feeling of coffee grounds with every bite. The flavor of the truffles were extremely strong.
I am so sad that this is clearanced aty local grocery storeI find it really delicious, with a strong coffee liqueur flavor that is not overshadowed by the sweet richness of the chocoate.
This nice cream is my ultimate favorite. Its absolutely amazing. The cold brew ice cream hits the spot every time, and biting into a coffee liquor truffle is just divine. I am addicted.

column4: I had to throw it out
column5: I had to throw it out, Which is very sad because I love Ben & Jerry’s and this is the first flavor that I just could not stomach. The coffee Lacore is just too much it’s offputting
Love this stuff! After a competitor stopped making my favorite ice cream, I found this and I'm so glad I did! It's now my favorite ice cream. Don't ever stop making this...YUM!!!!
My husband is an ice cream lover, he will eat almost any flavor, even if he isn't crazy about it. He tossed this in the trash because it's just that awful! I hated it too.
Next to the sadly retired Wavy Gravy ( I am still sad) Chillin the Roast may be my favorite! I am frustrated however because I am finding it difficult to locate in stores.
this is the first coffee ice cream i've had that astes like actual coffee was so excited when i saw it and definitely lived up to my expectations!!! my new favorite!!!

column4: My favorite flavor of ice cream EVER
column5: I always need some in the freezer! I’m sad that none of my grocery stores sell it anymore though. I can’t find it anywhere. :’( Still the ice cream love of my life!

column4: The ONLY coffee ice cream I truly enjoy
column5: I love coffee but everytime I tried coffee flavored ice cream, I've always been disappointed. Until NOW! Thank you Ben and Jerry's for this awesome new flavor!!
i cant find this flavor anywhere!! i think its because not many people like it but i love it! its for true coffee lovers only! PLEASE PUT IT BACK IN STORES!!!!
This has quickly taken over as my favorite B&J ice cream flavor! I freakin love it! The only thing that could make it better is more truffles! Omg SO GOOD!
Great coffee flavor that is complimented by the coffee liqueur truffles. Has that beautiful chocolate flavor but the coffee is not overpowered by sweetness
It kind of tastes like Baileys, but gross. I’ve never been disappointed by Ben or Jerry until tonight. Still love them, but my heart and stomach hurt.
The coffee bits are so concentrated, it tastes like alcohol. But if you add chocolate syrup, it balances it out enough for me to where I can enjoy it.

column4: Great coffee flavor but too much liquor flavor
column5: Love the coffee ice cream but the truffle chunks taste like straight up alcohol.... it put a damper on what could’ve been an amazing ice cream.
I bought this many times and it is one of my favorite flavors they have come out with. I have been so disappointed I cant find it any more!
I have never met a B&J flavor I didn’t like. Until now. The truffles ruined it for me - a nasty burst of bitter. So disappointed. :(

column4: Not as good as other coffee flavors
column5: Coffee base tastes kind of watered down. Truffles are overpowering and not very tasty in comparison. First pint I failed to finish.
I love the cold brew ice cream because I love coffee grinds. But I did not care for the truffles, they are extremely overpowering.
I tried this on a whim and I’m so glad that I did. It’s delicious! Sweet cookie truffles in coffee ice cream. Absolutely divine!
The ratio of truffle to ice cream is perfect. I love the spin on the coffee ice cream flavor, i hope this one is here to stay!!!
Whoever thinks this flavor is gross is CRAZY! Guess you have to be a true coffee lover to appreciate how DELICIOUS this is!!
Perfect mix of all my favorite things! I’m a huge fan of coffee icecream but also chocolate, and this is the perfect combo.
I have purchased this flavor twice. Its hard to find but GR8 to eat. I totally loved it! It for the true coffee lovers....
I like coffee flavored products, but this was way too bitter for my liking. Also not a fan of the whole Truffle gimmick.
I just bought this today. I love it! Coffee is one of my favorite flavors of ice cream, this did not disappoint!!

Delicious! I love the texture of the truffles. Unfortunately, not available everywhere
Or at least not yet!
I got this a year ago and feel in love right away. Jut wish I could find more and more. The best flavor yet.
The coffee flavor is amazing but the truffle had a to strong of after taste. The fudge was spot on as well.
A coffee party in your mouth! I just saw these were clearanced at Walmart. I HOPE they're not going away
Taste absolutely amazing. I absolutely love the coffee truffle pits in my ice along with amazing flavor.

column4: Yummy liquer flavor! Very intense coffee taste!
column5: Bought this to try something new! Wasn’t expecting much from the coffee, Exceeded my expectations!

column4: Much better than the 3.2 score it's getting 062118
column5: Had this yesterday, thoroughly impressed. Much more then other flavors getting much higher scores.
The truffles were soggy & disgusting and did not compliment the already off flavored ice cream.
Great complex flavor combination that just works. I really hope this one sticks around.
This my favorite ice cream. However, I could not find it this year. Is it discontinued?
It's the best Ben and Jerry ice cream hands down. However it's really hard to find :(
Ice cream was bland and the liqueur truffles were disgusting. Had to pick them out!
All the things I want in ice cream. If I can’t have Festivus anymore I’ll take this.
Love Chillin the Roast Truffles . Also love coffee toffee crunch and phish food
The texture is odd, really grainy. The truffle flavour is strong but unpleasant.

A combo of the best ingredients ever!!
Coffee + chocolate + liquor = amazing!!
This is one my favorites from the truffle series! Target refuses to carry it!
A superb blend of flavors and textures! I thoroughly enjoyed this ice cream!
This is the most amazing ice cream I’ve ever enjoyed!! A true masterpiece!!
Disappointed. To sum up the flavor in one word ... Ashtray.
The ice cream was really tasty, but the truffles ruin it.
It’s everything I want in an ice cream , it’s so good!!
Truffles bring big, deep flavor. Hits all flavor notes.
New favorite flavor. Would recommend to coffee lovers.
Saw it at the store, got it, and going back for more.
Not my favorite, the coffee flavor was kind of strong
This flavor was simply delicious is all I can say!!!
I Simply Love It Please Keep Forever And Ever!!!!!!!
Threw it away without finishing it. Honestly awful

column4: Hey Ben and Jerry where is my cookie dough?
column5: Always have loved your chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream, my husband knows this and came home with some. Well it takes very little to excite me these days but after a day of errands, housework, homework, dinner then getting son to bed all I kept thinking of, was that small tub of heaven in my freezer. So finally I put on some Guilty pleasure reality television snugged into my couch with my favorite blanket and my favorite ice cream only to notice that after a couple spoonfuls......NO COOKIE DOUGH! This can’t be correct NOOOOOOOOO!! First I was really doubting I was smarter than a fifth grader and now NO COOKIE DOUGH! Not the ending I needed to this day!

column4: Expensive vanilla ice cream - Where's the dough?
column5: Mine does not look like the example photo... there was barely any cookie dough! I basically just paid over £4 for a tub of vanilla ice cream. Very disappointing.

I've bought this a number of times. Usually there is not enough dough, lately there's been enough dough but it not's equally distributed. Lots of bites of just plain vanilla.
Maybe you should take whatever quantity of dough being used and make the balls smaller - that way the dough can be more evenly spread throughout the ice cream. Most of the dough seems to end up at the bottom on the pint. You're definitely not using the same amount of chips as in the picture. I'm okay with not getting dough in very bite, but want chips in very bite. Lately the price seems to be much cheaper than it use to be....is that the reason for less chips or dough?

Ben & Jerry's Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough ice cream has been a favorite of mine since I was a kid. I always appreciated the rich vanilla ice cream and chunks of flavorful cookie dough (the dough isn't dry and flavorless like some other cookie dough ice creams). Sometimes you don't want a busy ice cream with too many extras and this is perfect. I usually go into it with the goal of only eating half the container, but always end up finishing it in one sitting. Classic, reliable, and delicious.

column4: Whered the chocolate chip chunks go!?
column5: Ive eatten this ice cream before, considering its the only non dairy i enjoy. I have gotten this as my favorite one out of the flavors so many times and never have i had this happen. Its good till november 13 2020. Todays date is july 2019. As you can see in the photo below....its just vanilla with cookie dough bites in it....WHY!? Im not that upset it still tastes good. I just hope it was processed right and not a recall of some sort and still put out on shelves.

column4: Only 1 small dime sized piece of cookie dough
column5: I NEVER review anything, especially not food. But I live in Canada where this ice cream can run up to $10!! Wayyyyy more than other brands but you hope to get what you pay for. There was one small piece of cookie dough on the top, zero other pieces in the entire tub. The texture was weird and icy. I've had the same kind before and it was way better. With a brand this $$$ a consumer expects consistency. I will be switching to another brand from here on out.

I just opened a pint of this last week and was disappointed in the quality of the cookie dough. Unlike a lot of the other reviewers, mine had enough of the cookie dough, but the dough tasted old and was too hard. I tried leaving it to sit out for a while to see if it had just needed to thaw a bit, but that did not do the trick.

Ben and jerrys cookie dough has always been my favourite Ice cream, hate to admit but I can eat up to 3 tubs a week = £15 a week! My last 3 tubs have been disgusting, with an icy texture and the dough bits crumbly and biscuit like as opposed to the usual doughy texture. Will not be buying again as 3 times for this to happen is more than enough. I have the full 3 tubs in the freezer as they were completely inedible, ready to take back to the retailer to complain tomorrow but I'm guessing they are going to take it up with you guys.

column4: Disappointing! Where is the Cookie Dough?!
column5: After trying B&Js for the first time (Half Baked which was absolutely DELICIOUS), I became a recent fan and had to come back and try their Cookie Dough flavour. Well, what a complete waste of money! I am well aware that B&J has always been more expensive than other ice cream brands (especially living in Australia) but have always been happy to pay more for a premium product. Little did I know, I would open my tub to discover next to no cookie dough in the whole thing! What's the point of having a couple of teeny millimeter specks? Why pay more for this product when you can get perfectly fine vanilla ice cream from a competitor at a lower cost?! My last experience with Half Baked was amazing but now I'm personally unsure whether I will repurchase a B&J product again as I don't want to repeat this experience of buyers remorse and utter disappointment.

I love Ben and Jerry's chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream. It helps me relax after a rough day. But, the most recent pint I bought the cookie dough was hard and brittle and dry? I don't know how to describe it but it was weird and not the norm. Even the ice cream itself had a chalkiness to it. So disappointing since it's a splurge to purchase Ben and Jerry's as a grad student on a budget.

I love Ben & Jerry’s Cookie Dough. I just crushed yet another pint of it and yet again, I loved every spoonful of it! The ice cream is rich and delicious and the dough globs are ridiculous! So good that I eat it with a toddler spoon so I take smaller bites. My goal one day is to combine a pint of this with a pint of chocolate fudge brownie for a double half baked!!

I rarely indulge in Ben & Jerry's, but when I do, I go for the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. Unfortunately, my most recent experience was less than satisfying. The pieces of dough felt like they were missing a few ingredients. Instead of having that really amazing soft, chewy, dough texture... they tasted like dough powder. It was dry and bland. Did the formula change or are you guys still having issues with manufacturing?

column4: Don't believe the bad reviews like I did!!!
column5: Not sure what the bad reviewers are on, but give me two please! This stuff is the real deal. I've literally tried all the other brands of Choc Cookie Dough and in the trash they went. I buy maybe 3 of these a week at least. Too hard to walk past. B and J is all that and more. Love you guys and your product! ps. there's always plenty of cookie dough, must be a factory issue. I've always had it packed full of dough and it's been a long time..

I usually love Ben and Jerry's and buy it for a special treat. Today I bought the Cholcoate Chip Cookie Dough and was sooooo looking forward to the promised "Globs" of cookie dough. Sad to say in the whole pint (yes, I planned on eating all of it) there were only 7 smallish balls of cookie dough... overall, the taste of the ice cream is great however, the experience became a game of hunt and peck rather than the enjoyment I was looking for. Next time I'll opt for Brownie Batter Core, lol.

Maybe it's not the most exciting flavor, but the contrast of the plain (but very good) vanilla ice cream and the ambrosia-like cookie dough chunks makes this flavor one of the most enjoyable to eat. You just have to beat the temptation to dig out every bite of cookie dough before you eat the rest of the ice cream! I've tried many kinds of cookie dough ice cream and this has by far the best cookie dough (and ice cream for that matter) of all of them.

Super big chunks of cookie dough, tons of chocolate chips, creamy ice cream and always filled to the BRIM! I did run into a huge air pocket on the side so I didnt get ALL of the container filled, but my body is probably thankful for that. The lid can sometimes be hard to put back on. But other than those functional pieces, the flavor is amazing and this is always a solid GO-TO always!

column4: Buy it only if you are up for a cookie dough hunt
column5: I have purchased the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough multiple times so don't even try to tell me it's due to a particular ''manufacturing problem''. There is barely any cookie dough in the 500 mL pint. It is a total waste of my money.

Id give this flavor 3.5 stars if I could. Ben & Jerrys is usually awesome for me, a 4/5 stars typically (and Im a very tough ice cream critic) but this one just wasnt one of their better flavors. Now, this may be my fault because it is a rather stereotypical simple flavor, and I usually only get it at ice cream shops because their cookie dough and ice cream just taste better for some reason. So Im comparing this to my top favorite fresh cookie dough ice cream at ice cream shops, and to ben & Jerrys other more exciting flavors. If youre struggling to choose which brand of cookie dough ice cream you want at the store, just for the ben & Jerrys, its for sure one of the best brands for that flavor.

I was so disappointed by the chocolate chip cookie dough. There was hardly any cookie dough, the texture was gross and the ice cream was solid as a rock which made it very difficult to scoop and eat. I won't be buying that again, especially at that price!

column4: Really yummy but lacking cookie dough
column5: I really enjoy this flavour of B&J but lately it's definitely been lacking cookie dough. I am essentially paying for expensive vanilla ice cream; had anyone been searching for B&J's plain vanilla ice cream but had no luck, they could just pick up a pint of B&J's cookie dough and get exactly what they wanted. As a student I'm struggling to justify continuing to purchase this ice cream regularly as it's inconsistent with the distribution of cookie dough. I hope to receive some form of compensation and I hope to see Ben and Jerry take more action in bettering and improving this product.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough is my most favorite one of all. It has the perfect balance of vanilla ice cream,chocolate chip pieces,and chunks of choc chip cookie dough. I personally eat a pint a night, and I wouldn't know how to act if I didn't have any. It is definitely my new,but not so new,OBSESSION!

I love this ice cream it is so delicious and wants to just melt her mouth this ice cream is not too expensive its really good you should get my ice cream over at Walmart I have not at Sams Club they have good deals in it especially in my shrooms are you guys going to go check it out

column4: I promise you..you'll love it dough XDXD
column5: Best ice cream like seriouslyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

The chocolate chip cookie dough was so hard and chalky! It wasn’t soft or fresh?? Not sure if this was a manufacture or transit problem. Extremely disappointed this was my first experience because my friends have always recommended this flavor to me

My alllll time favorite flavor! It is a perfect blend on chocolate chip, cookie dough and ice cream! This product is affordable but a liiiiitle on the high side when in comes to calories ESPECIALLY if you eat the whole pint like i do

column4: Possibly better than the real thing
column5: Ben and Jerry's never disappoints. I have had the chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream in both NYC and Burlington, Vermont, and both were nothing short of amazing. Maybe I was lucky, but the cookie dough portions were generous and the vanilla ice cream added some nice contrast. :)

This was the most expensive Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough ice cream I've purchased, but also the least flavorful. Mostly just the ice cream- very few cookie dough bites or chocolate chunks. Left me disappointed.

The cookie dough chunks in this, are very rare, or actually really inconsistent. I wish there were more chunks of cookie dough. Overall, this is by far the best tasting cookie dough ice cream. The cookie dough is good, it's just that sometimes I have 10 cookie dough chunks and once I've had 2 pieces. I just wish there were more globs.

The vanilla ice cream is rich, creamy and has a strong vanilla the taste. I cant complain about the quantity of cookie dough because half the container was cookie dough. Unfortunately, the cookie dough was dry, crumbly and crunchy. I expected the cookie dough to be chewy and fresh, maybe I just got a bad batch.
I love the cookie dough! It tastes so good. This is probably one of my least favorite Ben and Jerrys flavors though, as I find the icecream to be pretty bland.

column4: Dough was to dry and didnt taste as usual
column5: Today we bought a new Ben&Jerrys Cookie dough ice cream and we've been total dissapointed. The dough was dry, too hard and didnt taste as usual.

Ben and Jerry's made this flavor first, so they're well known for it. It's a not horrible flavor, it's kind of just there. My biggest complaint with this is that there isn't enough cookie dough, and I don't think it's because of some mistake in the manufacturing process. It kind of tastes like vanilla ice cream with the occasional chunk of dough. You could seriously improve this flavor if you increased the amount of cookie dough you put into these pints.

column4: Delicious Vanilla Ice cream But not enough cookie
column5: Good vanilla ice cream but not enough cookie dough

This purchase left me very disappointed. It was as if I purchase a pint of vanilla ice cream. I didn't come across any cookie dough until after I was halfway through the container. At this point, I didn't eat any more ice cream but wasted the rest of the ice cream searching for the cookie dough. I doubt I will make this purchase again.

I like many others who wrote reviews am very upset about the lack of cookie dough in this cookie dough ice cream. My pint of ice cream had 4 pieces of cookie dough max. I expected better from Ben and Jerry's. I could have paid less for a different brand and got way more. But I thought they were the best-of the best, I was wrong.

I was super excited to try Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough since it has always been my favorite. I thought Ben and Jerry's would have been excellent but I was wrong. Unfortunately, all I could taste was coconut. I looked on the ingredient list and it states coconut oil is in the product but didn't list it as an allergen on the label. I am allergic to all coconut (yes even the oil) and tree nuts and was extremely disappointed as I had to throw the rest away. No more Ben and Jerry's for me.

It seems like the biggest complaint for this product is too little dough, which I agree with (no, it's not a manufacturing issue, in my case). But I also think that is the issue with ALL cookie dough ice cream. Just look up "what ice cream has the most cookie dough" and while you'll find that Ben and Jerry's does, but it still might not be enough. Clearly there is a consumer demand for a truly loaded cookie dough ice cream. I hope Ben and Jerry's will indulge us. Unfortunately, this product isn't it.

I juat bought one of these for the first time..I took the first bite and no cookie dough..took another bite and then another still no cookie dough. So I turned it around and took a bite from the other side still nothing. there was not one price of cookie dough in the whole thing so I paid for Something I did not get and I'm very upset about it I have are Ben and jerseys my whole life and have never been disapointed until now

column4: Would be excellent if there was cookie dough
column5: The first time I bought a pint of this I was over the moon with the ratio to cookie dough to ice cream to Chico chips, but as I kept purchasing I noticed there was less and less cookie dough/chocolate chips and more ice cream. This is disappointing and it’s kind of a waste of money to buy 6 dollar ice cream when you aren’t getting what you’re buying.

column4: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Is BAE
column5: Can we start by saying that Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough is bae?!? I started purchasing this flavor over a year ago & I’ve been addicted every since! The ONE thing I would change is having more cookie dough in each pint. I often feel like I have to buy more before finishing fully because I run out of cookie dough lol! I did try the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Core & plan to leave my honest opinion under its own picture!
The Classic Ben and Jerry's. This is the best of all flavors and shall forever be.
Everyone knows Ben & Jerry's is the best. Let's get real here.

If you havent tried Ben & Jerrys I honestly dont know what youre doing I live in Vermont and that was where Ben and Jerrys was invented and honestly I think theyre awesome because of the variety they give you and all the different kinds they have their ice cream cones taste amazing in their ice cream even though there are funky flavors they all suck each other very well and then come up with the best names for them you cant go wrong with any of their flavors[product:ben-&-jerrys-chocolate-chip-cookie-dough-ice-cream]

This ice cream is also really good! The only issue I have is that there is so much variance in the amount of cookie dough bites that sometimes there are not enough and others there are WAY too many to be a nice balance. The cookie dough pieces and vanilla ice cream are a classic pair and this ice cream is very good!

I loooove this, flavor I buy it all the time. I recently found out a friend of mine is pregnant and she stopped eating it. I’m just curious if the eggs in the dough are raw? Or is it safe for pregnant women to eat? If so I could let her know and she can eat as much as her heart desires. Thanks!

I’ve been buying Ben and Jerry ice cream off and on for years. I’m referring to the last year I have been purchasing your cookie dough ice cream. Although it never contained the amount of cookie dough consumers were led to believe it did in the advertised pictures or descriptions it still contained more and better tasting cookie dough than other brands I have tried. I was pleased a lot times in the beginning, but I still would have liked to see more cookie dough. Also with most of the cookie dough being toward the top and very little or almost none further down was another disappointing factor. I also find consistency to be all over the place.

I really love how Ben and Jerry's always have these crazy new flavors, but this one is my all-time favorite. While the ice cream is all sweet, I like the perfect balance of salt in the cookie dough to even out the taste. Even though the price of the pint is not always right, it was good for at least three servings because I tend to only eat two scoops at a time. If you are planning for a big party, this might not be enough for obvious reasons. However, for a kick on an occasional sweet tooth, it is perfect!

Cookie dough is my all time favorite flavor no matter what brand, so I have to thank yall for inventing this. That being said, this is hands down the BEST out of them all! Nothing comes close to this, you can tell the cookie dough could make actual cookies.

I don’t always go for ice cream, but when I do this is my favourite. I actually just made a cake for my son with this. Oreo cookie base, Ben and Jerry’s cookies and creak ice cream and drizzle chocolate sauce and let it set in the freezer. Amazing

i love that flavor! I am 10 years old i just got done eating some chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream 15 minutes ago. I visited the factory in Vermont in August. The chocolate chip cookie dough i had 15 minutes ago was from Ben and Jerrys

Since I was little Ben & Jerry’s cookie dough ice cream has been one of my favorites. It is a little more expensive than some other brands but the flavor is worth it. I will buy more and definitely recommend trying it.

I could eat this for breakfast lunch and dinner haha I absolutely love this ice cream. It’s the best hands down. It’s a little pricey but you get what you pay for. This is an all time fav at girls night for sure.

Not sure what luck everyone else is having but mine always has plenty of dough. It's really good dough! And the icecream doesn't taste plain, it's very vanilla flavored, almost like a vanilla bean icecream.

I love this ice cream. Especially since Blue Bell has its issue with the recalls in the past. Every since I’ve been eating this brand and I just say I’m not disappointed at all. Overall I’m satisfied with!

Omg my favourite ice cream! Everything about this ice cream is amazing! Ice cream is my fave and I’m very picky but this is delicious. The only thing I would say is that my local supermarkets sell for £5!
Does it really get any better than ben and Jerry's ice cream? I mean c'mon?! Always a staple for our family on movie night. So many different flavors to choose from so everyone gets their own.
So sad that I decided to break my no ice cream streak with this particular flavor. There was barely any cookie dough, and even less chocolate chips. Waste of the $8 a pint costs in NYC.

column4: It was ok vanilla ice cream
column5: Got a pint for cheat day, and there was not a single cookie dough pellet in the entire pint. It was plain vanilla ice cream with about 15 chocolate chips in the whole thing.
Cookie dough really taste like cookie dough. It’s really hard to find an ice cream that has that real dough taste. You also get dough or chocolate chips in every bite.
An absolute favourite ! Plus I love the half baked flavour. The mix of flavours this brand offers differentiates itself from other brands and is totally worth it!
Nice big chunks of cookie dough, great vanilla ice cream. I mean can you really go wrong with Ben and Jerry's?
Dangerous to have in my house I’ll eat it all. It is the only comfort food that my life needs. Get you some
Not a single piece of cookie dough! Very frustrating! Especially at the price of Ben & Jerry's!
Guilty pleasure! Perfect for the sweet tooth, lots of cookie dough pieces and chocolate chips.
Tasted like Just really sugary Vanilla Ice Cream, I couldn't taste the cookie dough gobs.

Decided to indulge in a Ben & Jerry’s cookie dough pint and it was a disappointing splurge! This is the second time now having this experience. The ice cream was very chalky and had a weird after taste. Maybe an inconsistent batch? No cookie dough chunks a few chocolate bits, was very dry and brittle. The base vanilla ice cream had a chalky taste to it and as you tried to scoop it out of the pint was flaky. No ice crystals but left a powdery film on your palate.
They tasted ok I guess, but there wasn't one piece of cookie dough in the entire box I bought; that's the reason for my review. Quality was fine but without cookie dough they aren't what I bought.

I'm really not a sweets fan and by association an 8ce cream fan but who doesn't love Ben & Jerry's Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Ice Cream? It's just good! Smooth and creamy with bite sized chunks of the raw cookie dough that you all know we grew up stealing and eating if our moms were baking cookies. Mine didn't but I learned how to as a kid so that's what I did. As a whole it's a great brand with unique flavors. Something for everyone.

Like many of the other reviewers, I can't find much cookie dough. I usually spend the extra cash for Ben and Jerry's, but I am so disappointed in this flavor. I guess I will go back to buying a gallon of another brand for the same price. I had such high hopes when I bought this.....

This was delicious. They have enough chunks of cookie dough so that there was at least one little cookie dough bite in each spoon full. Theres also a great balance of the cookie dough, chocolate chips, and ice cream so that youre able to actually taste all the ingredients. Only downfall for me is the taste of the ice cream base, it is kind of bland and think it could have more of a vanilla or cookie dough flavor.

For starters this is my go to chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream brand because I feel as if they put the most cookie dough bites in their ice cream. I know they tend to be on the pricier side but I dont mind paying a little more considering the companies values. I encourage anyone to look into Ben & Jerrys and learn more about how they are passing it forward to their employees and the world.

Ive recently became a fan of the half baked ice cream , that it made me wana try just a cookie dough flavor. I bought one and there were very little cookie dough globs . Barely enough yo satisfy my sweet tooth.

Super big chunks of cookie dough, tons of chocolate chips, creamy ice cream and always filled to the BRIM! I did run into a huge air pocket on the side so I didnt get ALL of the container filled, but my body is probably thankful for that. The lid can sometimes be hard to put back on. But other than those functional pieces, the flavor is amazing and this is always a solid GO-TO always!

It's a classic for a reason-- it's just so delicious. I think this is the first chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream I ever tried, and, while I've tried many kinds since then, Ben and Jerry's cookie dough remains my favorite. The vanilla ice cream is creamy and delicious and not overly sweet. The cookie dough tastes just like homemade cookie dough. Together, it's just perfection.

I love the fact Ben & Jerry isnt afraid to use their brand & platform to speak out on social issues harming our society! I also enjoy this flavor, I wish they werent stingy on the cookie dough though. The ice cream is a tad expensive too. But, this os the only brand I buy when I get Ice cream. Please sponsors me, Ben & Jerry, I eat this too much to not become apart of the team.
I love Ben and Jerrys and I love their message and brand so I never mind spending money on this ice cream! This is a grea
